summary: A series of Bureau of Prisons (BOP) clinical encounter notes for inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, covering the period from July 14 to July 28, 2019. The documents detail his medical complaints, including hyperlipidemia and back pain, and record a significant incident on July 23 where he was found with a rope around his neck, resulting in erythema and abrasions. He insinuated his cellmate was involved but refused to elaborate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of all medical records, detailing his health complaints, a neck injury incident, and his refusal to fully explain the circumstances of his injuries.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: Clinician who assessed Epstein's neck injury on July 23 and 24, documented his insinuation about his cellmate, and noted he was placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: SAD
persons.context: Individual who made an amendment to a clinical note on July 26, 2019.

connections.description: Epstein was under the medical care of the MD, who evaluated him, prescribed medication, and cosigned clinical notes.
The MLP provided direct clinical assessment of Epstein's neck injury and documented his statements regarding his cellmate.
The RN performed follow-up nursing encounters, monitoring Epstein's vital signs and symptoms of neuropathy.

events.title: Epstein Found with Neck Injury
events.description: Epstein was found in his cell (Special Housing Unit 205-Cell 124) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He claimed he did not know what happened, stating 'Just went to drink a little water and wake up snorting.' He had circular erythema and abrasions on his neck.

events.title: Epstein Insinuates Cellmate Involvement
events.description: During a follow-up visit, Epstein told the MLP, 'I think my room mate had to do with what happened to me.' He refused to say anything further. The MD was notified of this statement.

events.title: Epstein Reports Neuropathy Symptoms
events.description: Epstein reported ongoing 'pins and needles' in his right hand and a prior episode where he woke up with no control over his right arm for a few minutes.

events.title: Chronic Care Evaluation
events.description: Epstein had a physician evaluation for chronic conditions including hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, and severe spinal stenosis causing numbness and pain.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell with a rope around his neck, resulting in visible injuries (erythema and abrasions).
Epstein insinuated to medical staff on July 24, 2019, that his cellmate was involved in the neck injury incident, but he refused to provide details or formally accuse anyone.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch following the July 23 incident.
The medical records document Epstein's chronic health issues, including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, and spinal stenosis.
The documents show a pattern of Epstein being evaluated by medical staff (RN, MLP, MD) in the days leading up to his death, with notes cosigned by physicians.
